page.text: Friday, 14 September 2012]
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF PROVINCES NO 28─2012
OURTH
S
ESSION
, F
OURTH
P
ARLIAMENT
Indicates translated version of the question.
Indicates a question for oral reply.
Minister for Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs ............................................ 278
Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities ........................................ 274, 277
[Friday, 14 September 2012
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF PROVINCES NO 28─2012

text.b: 495. Mr D A Worth (DA-FS) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People with

page.text: Whether, in light of August being celebrated as Women’s Month and the high
incidents of rape and violence against women and children, the (a) Domestic
Violence Act, Act 116 of 1998, and (b) Criminal Law Amendment Act, Act 105 of
1997, have been implemented effectively; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant
details;
whether the lives of (a) women and (b) children have been uplifted by providing
them with (i) better education and (ii) access to health care; if not, why not; if so,
what are the relevant details?
CW603E

text.b: Mr D A Worth (DA-FS) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: (a) When is it anticipated that the rail-corridor between South Africa and the
Democratic Republic of Congo will be completed and (b) how will the corridor
facilitate trade between the Southern African Development Community (SADC);
whether the SADC countries will financially benefit from this rail-corridor; if not,
why not; if so, how?
CW606E

text.b: Mr K A Sinclair (COPE-NC) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: Whether, with reference to a lecture he delivered at the China Executive Leadership
Academy in Shanghai on 28 September 2011 (details furnished), he will provide details
regarding (a) the role that the state-owned enterprises (SOEs) of South Africa will play in
the economic development of Africa, (b) specific progress that has been achieved between
the SOEs of South Africa and China and (c) the impact that the interaction between SOEs of
South Africa and China will have on the economy and infrastructure needs of (i) Africa in
general and (ii) South African in particular; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant
details?
CW608E

text.b: 498. Mr O de Beer (COPE-WC) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land

page.text: Whether any evaluations and assessments of the Comprehensive Rural Development Plan
(CRDP) to fight poverty have been made (a) in (i) 2010 and (ii) 2011 and (b) from 1 January
2012 up to the latest specified date for which information is available; if not, why not; if so,
what are the relevant details?
CW609E
Friday, 14 September 2012]
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF PROVINCES NO 28─2012

text.b: Mr F Adams (ANC-WC) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:

page.text: Whether the Government has taken a policy position requiring Israeli goods from
Jewish settlements in the West Bank to be labelled as originating from the occupied
Palestinian territory; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether there have been any bilateral engagements between South Africa and Israel
since this position was undertaken; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so,
what are the relevant details;
what monitoring mechanisms are in place to (a) enforce and (b) monitor the
implementation of South Africa’s position in this regard?
CW612E

text.b: Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: Whether any (a) private and/or (b) public South African entity has (i) supplied and/or
(ii) sold any arms to the government of Rwanda (aa) during the past three financial
years and (bb) from 1 April 2012 up to the latest specified date for which
information is available; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, (aaa) what
was the total value of the sale for this period and (bbb) which arms;
whether these arms are being used for defence purposes only; if not, what is the
position in this regard; if so, how was this conclusion reached?
CW615E

text.b: Mr D V Bloem (COPE-FS) to ask the Minister of Correctional Services:

page.text: (a) How many court cases relating to parole issues has his department (i) won in the
(aa) 2008-09, (bb) 2009-10 and (c) 2010-11 financial years and (ii) lost and (b) how
many of these cases resulted in financial implications for the Government;
(a) how many of these cases are (i) labour-related and (ii) parole issues and (b) how
many of these cases are currently before the court and (c) what is the duration
thereof;
whether the legal advice received in respect of the various cases in which his
department is a litigant has been found to be correct; if not, what is the position in
this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?
CW630E

text.b: Mr K A Sinclair (COPE-NC) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: With reference to the legal action of the SA Airways against the former chief executive
officer regarding the misspending of funds, (a) how much of these funds have been
recovered and (b) what is the current status of litigation?
CW631E

text.b: Mr K A Sinclair (COPE-NC) to ask the Minister of Economic Development:

page.text: With regard to the Green Economy drive, what progress has been made in terms of the New
Growth Path in relation to the (a) number of jobs that have been created, (b) the sectors in
which these jobs were created and (c) cost of each job opportunity that has been created?
CW632E
[Friday, 14 September 2012
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF PROVINCES NO 28─2012

text.b: Mr O de Beer (COPE-WC) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: Whether he has been informed of the staff shortages at the Malmesbury Police
Station; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details;
what steps have been taken to (a) ensure proper staff compliment at the station and
(b) make the police station more accessible to residents that are affected by crime in
hotspot areas?
CW634E

text.b: Mr O de Beer (COPE-WC) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: Whether the Swartland Hospital is part of the Infrastructure Development Plan for hospital
upgrades; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
CW635E

text.b: Mr R A Lees (DA-KZN) to ask the Minister of Water and Environmental Affairs:

page.text: Whether the required environmental approvals have been (a) applied for and (b)
awarded for the cemetery which is under construction in the Bluebank Road on the
outskirts of Ladysmith in KwaZulu-Natal; if not, what action has to be taken to
ensure that the structures erected are demolished; if so, what are the relevant details;
what is the name of the municipality that has started the construction of the
cemetery;
whether the site of the cemetery is part of a flood plain; if not, what is the position in
this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?
CW636E

text.b: Mr H B Groenewald (DA-NW) to ask the Minister of Communications:

page.text: With reference to the proposal by the Government Communication and Information System
(GCIS) that a certain percentage of the ad-spend be committed to a predetermined list of
media, as defined by the Media Development and Diversity Agency, (a) how has the GCIS
defined Community ad-spend, (b) what are the benefits to the industry, (c) how will the
predetermined list be established and (d) what are the further relevant details?
CW637E

text.b: Mr H B Groenewald (DA-NW) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: Whether the project manager of the (a) Medupi and (b) Kasib Power Stations is registered in
compliance with the regulations of the Project and Construction Management Professions
Act, Act 48 of 2000; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant
details in respect of the registration documents in each case?
CW638E

text.b: Mr H B Groenewald (DA-NW) to ask the Minister of Communications:

page.text: Whether any progress has been made with regard to the report to be compiled by the Media
Development and Diversity Agency (MDDA) on the state of ad-spend by the (a) public and
(ii) private sector; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant
details?
CW639E
Friday, 14 September 2012]
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF PROVINCES NO 28─2012

text.b: Mrs B L Abrahams (DA-Gauteng) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People

page.text: (a) How many persons with disabilities are (i) Members of Parliament (MPs) and (ii)
currently employed by Parliament and (b) what is the category level in each case?
CW640E

text.b: Mrs B L Abrahams (DA-Gauteng) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People

page.text: Whether any waiting list exists for houses for persons with disabilities; if not, what is the
position in this regard; if so, (a) how many persons are on the waiting list in each province,
(b) what is the anticipated period that each person has to wait in order to be allocated a
house and (c) what are the further relevant details?
CW641E

text.b: Mr D A Worth (DA-FS) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: Whether he intends to place the provincial department of Cooperative Governance,
Housing and Traditional Affairs in the Free State under administration as a result of
unauthorised expenditure; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether any investigations will be conducted to ascertain how these funds were
spent; if not, why not; if so, (a) what will be the scope of the investigation, (b) when
will the investigation (i) commence and (ii) be completed and (c) what are the further
relevant details;
whether any charges will be brought against any officials who have been found
guilty of misconduct; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
what steps will be taken to (a) prevent and (b) detect such expenditure?
CW642E

text.b: Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: What (a) progress has been made with the Quintile 1 schools since the date of
commencement, (b) challenges have been encountered so far in (i) schools and (ii) grades,
(c) steps have been taken to remedy the challenges encountered, (d) recommendations have
been made to rectify these challenges in each case, (e) are the names of each school that (i)
was already included in the plan and (ii) he intends to include and (f) are the relevant grades
in each case?
CW643E

text.b: Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: (a) What are the names of each primary health care (PHC) facility which implemented the
nutritional intervention for people living with (i) HIV/Aids and (ii) tuberculosis, (b) where is
each facility situated, (c) how many patients in respect of each PHC facility are included in
the intervention, (d) what is the (i) daily cost and (ii) total cost since the implementation date
up to the latest specified date for which information is available to supply each patient with
the nutritional supplements and (e) who is responsible for (i) monitoring and (ii)
coordinating the progress of the plan?
CW644E
[Friday, 14 September 2012
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF PROVINCES NO 28─2012

text.b: Mrs B L Abrahams (DA-Gauteng) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: (a) What are the reasons for hostels that have been built and developed into family units not
being occupied on completion, (b) how many (i) new hostel units were developed and (ii)
hostel units have been (aa) upgraded and (bb) developed into family units since 1 April
2009, (c) who will be the beneficiaries of these hostels in each case and (d) when will these
hostels be occupied?
CW645E

text.b: Prince M M M Zulu (IFP-KZN) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and

page.text: Whether his department has implemented the programmes detailed by him when he was
launching the R47 billion Strategic Integrated Project Number 7 (SIP 7) on 11 May 2012 as
part of the 17 Presidential Infrastructure Coordinating Commission (PICC); if not, (a) why
not and (b) when will these programmes be implemented; if so, what are the relevant
details?
CW646E

text.b: SUMMARY OF QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN REPLY

page.text: 38. Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) (p 18)—Social Development.
